isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 3.5: CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - SPEEDOMETER SIGNAL - SPEEDOMETER DOES NOT FUNCTION PROPERLY

svcproc.title: SPEEDOMETER DOES NOT FUNCTION PROPERLY
svcproc.para: The ECM/VPM diagnostics DO NOT check for VSS sensor adjustment, so it is possible with a miss-adjusted vehicle speed sensor to get a faulty vehicle speed signal without fault code 141 or 142. The speedometer and/or odometer will operate erratically or not at all. The odometer may not function correctly.

If Flash code 141 or 142 IS NOT PRESENT, but the speedometer and/or odometer does not function properly, perform Testing Speedometer ( Figure 3.186 and 3.187
).
If Flash code 141 or 142 is present and the speedometer does not function properly, correct the cause of the Flash Codes before troubleshooting the speedometer.
If the speedometer/odometer does not function properly when the Two-Speed Axle is shifted (HIGH or LOW), refer to Two Speed Axle.
